title: Strengthening Learning Design Practical Skills: Understanding-Centered Design Thinking for IoT Convergence Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level IoT concepts and foundational programming skills
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can perform the design process of converting real-world domain problems (medical/legal/technical) into IoT solutions with 80% accuracy.
Learners can generate stage-based deliverables—from problem definition to prototype development—using design thinking techniques.
Learners can reduce cognitive load in IoT system design by over 30% following understanding-centered design principles.

Learners in teams of 4 develop a practical IoT solution (e.g., smart home energy management system) through project-based assessment, achieving ≥4 points (5-point scale) in ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria during a final presentation (5-minute presentation + 3-minute Q&A).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
